Reviews.Content: Awesome stay! Stayed at the J and J for three nights in mid August. Awesome stay. Had a room with a king size bed overlooking a small court yard. Only three rooms had access to the court yard which was great. Absolutely beautiful stay, breakfast was decent but not the best but it is included in the price so why bother complain. Only down side was the noisy air conditioner in the room, constant humming got to be very annoying after a few hours. Washrooms are tight quarters and they should really have a soap dish in there not to have to leave the soap on the ground.Reception staff was quite nice and spoke english fluently. Would stay and recommend this hotel to others. Awesome local restaurant at the corner of the street called La Pentola dell'oro!
Reviews.Author: MarieMontreal

Reviews.Author: patsydog

Reviews.Content: Some Kind of Wonderful Make no mistake, the J and J is a hidden gem of a hotel. Location-wise, it's perfectly placed within walking distance of the main sights, but far enough away to give you a feeling of serenity when you're walking back down its quiet side street (Via Mezzo) at the end of a busy day. A former 16th century monastery, it retains enough original architectural and decorative features to give you at least a flavour of a serene monastic retreat, and the little courtyard is simply gorgeous. If you want a romantic retreat (like my Partner and I), and are brave enough to ditch the predictable comforts of the Hiltons and Marriots of this world, you should definitely check this hotel out. It seems as if many of the previous polarised reviews (either extremely good or extremely bad) were given on this basis - i.e. that the JJ doesn't live up to it's 4* status. If it's that kind of predictable luxury you're after, don't even consider this hotel. But in our opinion, it's the many differences and quirks it offers that makes it so charming. It's also in a really cool, slightly-studenty area, with many great eating establishments within easy walking distance. The area is also very 'non-touristy', so learn a few words of Italian, and try your best to mix with the locals. My only grumbles about the place are that the breakfast buffet is adequate rather than impressive, and the bar bills are outrageous (6 euros for a coke?!), but you live and learn. As some of the other reviews pointed out, the rooms really differ in style and location within the hotel. Rooms 1 and 2 are right on the communal courtyard, so if you're shy, it's probably best to avoid these! We had a superior double, and it was lovely. It felt like a private apartment rather than a hotel room. Will definitely be going back.
Reviews.Author: Flamenco_Sun

Reviews.Content: Not as great as we'd hoped The bedroom was ok. The bed fairly comfortable but bedding a bit shabby. There were no tea/coffee facilities in the bedroom and nowhere to relax apart from on the bed. The room was dark. The bathroom was the highlight of the accommodation with a huge bath and cascading shower. The breakfasts were absolutely shocking for the standard of accommodation. Stale bread rolls and pastries, dubious looking scrambled egg every other day. Yoghurts and cheese (?!). Bad coffee which was disappointing given we were in Italy. We wouldn't go back!
Reviews.Author: Sandrinhgam50

Reviews.Content: Away from the crowds       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: Bessie77

Reviews.Content: Cute and cosy Our third stop in Italy was Florence. We once again chose this hotel after reading reviews from TripAdvisor members.The quaint, cosy setting particularly appealed to us. We had booked a double deluxe room and were upgraded to a Jnr Suite. The room had all the charm we had been hoping for. A cosy loft style bedroom and ample lounge area downstairs. The bathroom was finished in stone and was a perfect, homely feeling hotel.The hotel was only a short walk from the Duomo with supermarkets located close by also.The dining area was small and personal, with a common area with comfortable lounges and reading material for a quiet moment between seeing Florence's wonderful sites.Highly recommend this hotel to any travelers passing though Florence!
Reviews.Author: davidandpaul

Reviews.Content: The perfect place for lovers... After a long search between charming hotels in Florence, my choice was at J AND J... My bet was won! Since the hotel is a real jewel of Florence.. It's like discover a secret place.. you'll never imagine that in that street you'll find a place like this! The 19 rooms are all different one to the other since the hotel was a medieval coventry once.. The suites are enormous.. we slept in room N掳 5 which was a deluxe and I really suggest it because it's special.. there is also a bathtube at the side of the giant bed!The only disappointment was the breakfast.. too small for a 4**** hotel.. Also the foreign service could be better...
Reviews.Author: FRANKLEONE

Reviews.Content: This little jewel in Florence has style Myself and my girlfriend were both looking much forward to see Florence and we had booked a small but seemingly pleasant hotel called J and J via recommendations on this and other sites.The carefully renovated little reneaissance palace turned out to be a hotel jewel, one of the most charming little hotels I have visited to date ! A very spacious and beautifully decorated jr suite, wonderfully quiet although in the heart of the city, was our airconditioned luxury home for one hot week in August. It was a delight to wake up for the generous breakfast buffet in the morning. The elegant and timeless interior of J and J is perfectly matched with a subtle modern touch such as a discrete plasma screen tv in the room, and a very inviting mosaic bathroom. The friendliness, professionalism and absolute customer dedication of the staff is normally only found in global five star hotels. Nevertheless, the little J and J has managed to keep their hotel atmosphere very homely and informal, which is just right when you are on a holiday. No stressed conference people running in there, no ugly corporate meeting signs. Just timeless Italian elegance at its best.
Reviews.Author: style_uncompromised

Reviews.Content: Lovely stay at the J and J Hotel This is a great little gem of the beaten track. All the attractions of Florence are within a 15mins walk and it feels less busy than in the centre of town where most of the hotels are located. Looks and feels like a Boutique hotel with a little seating area in the front and the breakfast room overlooking a lovely courtyard. Staff were extremely helpful. I ordered a bouquet of roses for my partner to be in the room on arrival and they turned out to be the largest long stemmed red roses I had ever seen. Staff also made great restaurant recommendation. One evening we dined in a small restaurant in a part of town where most tourist wouldn't go. I must say it was one of the best meals we ever had with the antipasto platter being freshly prepared in front of us.The room we stayed in was on the small side but had a large courtyard on the back which would have been great in summer. We also had a large canopy bed which I had always dreamed of sleeping in. This is the kind of hotel I would always recommend to anyone.
Reviews.Author: MGlaessel

Reviews.Content: Intimate,Far from the madding crowd       Bedroom JJ
Reviews.Author: Purn

Reviews.Content: Best secret in Florence You will absolutely love this renovated convent in the heart of Florence. The rooms are fabulous and the staff couldn't be more gracious. The hotel is int the middle of all of the sights on a small street that oozes history and makes you feel as though you are in the middle of the 12th century. Absolutely would recommend this for anyone wishing to have a great taste of Florence.
Reviews.Author: Mike3793

Reviews.Content: Hated the j and j Selected it because of the high rating of the Michelin guide. It was a big disappointment. Rooms are poor, not clean, shabby furniture, unpleasant bathrooms. The staff was ok. They showed us several rooms since the hotel was quite empty. All looked poor. Breakfast was a disgrace. A buffet full of nothing. Unbelievable how poor it was.We visited Florence many times and plan to visit it again. Will never stay at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Guy12

Reviews.Content: Paid for it, but didn't get to stay there After a full day of researching the internet, we thought we had found THE place and THE website that will book us a room at hotel that shows no more availability at the hotel's own website. So, we put in our credit card information and also, all the contact information necessary to contact us while in Italy and thought we had a place to stay. And if the hotel were to have difficulties, they would be so kind as to inform us before we even arrive or to have then to provide an alternative at the same rate and at least same standard, as --- customer service have defended this hotel.Check it out yourself: Is the Hotel Monna Lisa, really the same rate or same rating as Hotel J and J in Florence, Italy?And if we were given the opportunity to book another place or the Monna Lisa Hotel ourselves, it would have been at least, $44 less per day.Aside from this price difference, we did confront the Hotel J and J front desk about being charged for a four-star hotel and being put in a three-star hotel. They ignored us. Even with cc correspondence from traveleurope, they still ignored us. In fact, in that evening, after we had checked in at the Monna Lisa, the guy at the front desk of Hotel J and J, tried to look for our reservation and we didn't even show in their computers in the messed up room that they needed to fix. They lied and they pocketed the money.We will never book this hotel regardless of how pretty it looks. We have been lied to and cheated by this management.In fact, next time, we will rather stay and pay the correct rate at the Monna Lisa Hotel because it was very, very quite and had a very nice courtyard. It was also convenient. Parking was free. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The bathroom and room was clean. And that is all that matters...set expectations.
Reviews.Author: vbl385

Reviews.Content: Charming and friendly My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. The place is described as being an old convent and it oozes the charm of old Florence. The staff are friendly and excellent; all speak English and the front desk staff do so very well. The warm buffet breakfast is alright. Our room, I think, was not one of their best: narrow, extremely high-ceilinged with a not-so comfortable bed. The bathroom was very nicely done: clean, sleek, modern, and roomy. The neighborhood is authentically Florentine, set away from the big tourist draws but close enough to walk to them easily. Nearby are plenty of non-touristy restaurants chock-full of real Florentines. The price was right for a piece of old Florence.
Reviews.Author: SoCalifornian

Reviews.Content: pros and cons for this hotel We had a large family suite here which though very roomy with nice bathroom was a bit on the musty side.The carpets looked as if they have been there for many, many years and were very dirty.The big problem was we were eaten alive by mosquitos during the night ! On the plus side...nice staff and good location on a quiet, convenient street.
Reviews.Author: klaraVancouver_Bc

Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience with the J I was so surprised to read negative reviews of the JJ. I was somewhat nervous about staying here due to the paucity of reviews available, but was drawn in by the website and my pre-booking contact (via e-mail) with the staff. We had such a wonderful experience with the hotel and every person with whom we dealt (especially Deepak - he deserves a raise!). The JJ is located on a quiet street, yet close to pretty much everything. We were able to walk virtually everywhere in Florence that we wanted to go. We were a group of 7, and had 3 rooms, all double deluxe. We found our rooms to be reasonably sized and loved the updated bathrooms. The only tiniest bit of a complaint about our rooms would be the somewhat dim lighting in the bathroom. Not a big deal. The common areas were a great place for us to meet and relax while enjoying a bottle of wine. The only other tiniest bit of a complaint is that there were only 2 red wine options available at the bar and we exhausted both options the first night. Wanting to try something different, we returned from shopping the next day with a couple of other wine options. We were not permitted to drink them in the common areas. Since the wine selection is so limited, perhaps charging a corking fee (which we would gladly have paid) for guests wishing to consume other wines would be a way to deal with this issue? Perhaps there is some sort of restriction that prohibits this, who knows. The hotel staff was warm, welcoming, and always courteous and friendly. No matter who was on staff, we always received recommendations for restaurants and activities that were consistent with our requests. They took care of museum tickets in advance for us. They also recommended a driver to us who carted us around to various locations. She was a delight, as well. All in all, I would definitely stay at the JJ again, and would recommend it to anyone considering going to Florence. Having said that, I believe I know which room the person complaining about the hotel was referring to - the one on the courtyard. It does not look like an ideal place for privacy, but insist on a room not on the courtyard, and you should be fine. The JJ is, in my opinion, a hidden gem and a delightful place to relax in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't accept Room 1 The communal areas of this hotel are as in the website pictures - very attractively decorated and furnished. The service is friendly and the general location is good. However, we were allocated Room 1 which was not a room whose pictures appear on the website. The bedroom is on a Mezzanine balcony within the room which has the attraction of being unsual but is accessed by a very narrow stone spiral stairway which is definitely not to be negotiated after a bottle of Chianti. The TV is upstairs in the bedroom rather than downstairs in the sitting area. But the biggest problem is that this ground floor room looks out on to the communal courtyard and the breakfast room. This means that it is impossible to open the curtains because of privacy and hence the room gets no natural light. Despite all this it has the space of a Junior Suite and is therefore priced on this basis. I know we should have asked to move as soon as we arrived but we were tired after the journey and there was nothing so bad as to render the room uninhabitable. It was just that it was nothing like the other rooms shown on the web and as such it was a big disappointment. If you get allocated this room you will wonder what the fuss is about with this hotel and so it might be worth making a point when booking of specifying 'not room 1'!
Reviews.Author: Peter2706

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Awful! We had an awful experience with this hotel, and ended up switching hotels shortly after our arrival in Florence. Prior to travelling to Italy, I sent an email to the hotel to confirm our reservation, the type of room we had reserved, and the rate. I received a reply email back, and being excited for the trip, I visited their website again to view pictures of the room. However, I noticed that room we had booked was listed for a lower price during the same dates we were staying. I then emailed the hotel and asked if they would honor the lower rate advertised on their website. They replied back saying that the rate listed was for a different room, but for the same price as the double deluxe room they would upgrade us to a junior suite. I was absolutely delighted! When we reached Florence, however, our delight turned to horror. We were shown our room, which was extremely small (even by European standards), had shabby, run-down furniture, had a dirty bathroom, and looked like a bat cave (nothing like the website). We obviously were not upgraded, so we went back to the front desk to inquire about what happened. I showed the woman working at the front desk the printout of the email I received, and she merely shrugged and made a motion with her hands to tear it up. She informed us that she had sold the suite and that we would not receive the upgrade.To say that we were furious that an offer in writing wasn't honored was an understatement, and we couldn't believe how unprofessionally we were treated by the woman at the front desk. She even went into our file and accused us of making up the email, as she couldn't find it (and she was the one that wrote it!).After much arguing with the front desk, another person working at the hotel (who was very nice and professional) offered to move us to the suite (which wasn't sold after all?!?). By that time, however, we were so upset (in tears) by the initial treatment we received and the hotel's failure to honor their offer that we contacted another hotel (which ended up being wonderful!) and moved. This hotel is awful and does not live up to their written promises. I would highly recommend staying somewhere else while in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Apriljl

Reviews.Content: Florence at its Best The rooms are just as the pictures show. The room and furniture are all wonderful. I didn't know what to do with all the space. The bathroom was almost half the size of the room. I would recommed staying here. Close to all the attractions. Very close to great restaurants too.
Reviews.Author: abw75

Reviews.Content: Super city centre hotel We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in January (great deal with flights through Expedia). Ideal location in the historic Santa Croce area, excellent service (reception, bar, room) beautiful building with vaulted ceilings in reception and communal areas. Our room, a twin on the first floor, was beautifully decorated with antique furniture and a modern designer bathroom. Mild problem with lack of hot water one night but this was resolved within an hour. Steep stairs to some rooms (not an issue for us). We would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
